author: @psbjr
text: Hi there, I just wanted to add an update to the flaskapp.wsgi touch method for updating that I commented on in the more basic flask tutorial: to further simplify this, you can actually issue a touch command on flaskapp.wsgi from WinSCP by right clicking it and selecting "touch" from the "File custom commands" menu. This can be further automated by assigning a hotkey to that command which you can set from "Customize..." from the same right-click context menu. I set mine to ctrl+0 so now when I update a file I just select flaskapp.wsgi in winscp and hit ctrl+0, which is much more convenient than switching over to putty imo.  Also, I just noticed this and correct me if I'm wrong, you can shorten your style tag to 'style="margin: 5px 15px; height: 44px;" ' and achieve the same effect (top/bottom will be 5px and right/left will be 15px)
